brief_summary.textblock:
The distinction between Tuberculosis disease (TB), a worldwide infective granulomatosis
      requiring long-term antibiotic treatment, and sarcoïdosis, a rare granulomatous disease
      successfully treated with high dose steroids is not straightforward and may delay the
      treatment choice by the physician.

      The goal was to evaluate prospectively and consecutively the presence of epithelioid
      granulomas in salivary glands biopsy of patients with TB.

clinical_study.brief_title: Labial Biopsy in Patients With Tuberculosis Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adults above 18 years,

          -  bacteriologically confirmed tuberculosis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patient not able to sign written consent

clinical_study.keyword: usefullness of labial biopsy to distinguish between tuberculosis and sarcoidosis
clinical_study.official_title: The Value of Labial Biopsy in 65 Patients With Tuberculosis Disease

oversight_info.authority: ANSM agence Nationale de sécurité du medicament : Paris,France

primary_outcome.measure: presence of granuloma on labial biopsy
primary_outcome.time_frame: at day zero of treatment of tuberculosis
